feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 2:01PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM FRIDAY AFTERNOON... This product is relayed from the Alaska Department of Environmental Conservation. ALASKA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION Division of Air Quality AIR QUALITY ADVISORY
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage; Copper River Basin; Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 1:34PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOODING FROM LAKE DRAINAGE NEAR NUIQSUT... A lake 23 miles west of Nuiqsut is expected to drain rapidly into Judy Creek and Fish Creek sometime in the next two weeks, impacting camps downstream. Water levels are expect to rise 2 to 6 feet over a 12 to 24 hour period once it releases.

entry.summary: ...DENSE SMOKE ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Visibility less than one mile in dense smoke. * WHERE...Central Interior. * WHEN...Until 1 PM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.

entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THURSDAY TO 1 AM AKDT FRIDAY FOR HOT DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR THE MIDDLE KUSKOKWIM VALLEY... * Winds...South 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * Timing...Hot, dry, and windy conditions are expected Thursday afternoon and evening.

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued June 29 at 5:46AM AKDT until July 01 at 1:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THURSDAY TO 1 AM AKDT FRIDAY FOR HOT DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR THE WESTERN ALASKA RANGE... * Winds...Southeast 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 25 percent. * Temperatures...75 to 80 degrees. 60s over higher elevations.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 1:59PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIVER LEVELS THROUGH MID-WEEK... With record heat, significant snowmelt in higher terrain has caused high river levels and near bankfull conditions in rivers and streams throughout Upper Lynn Canal. This includes the Chilkat, the Klehini, and Taiya Rivers. No flooding is expected, although high water is anticipated.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 2:45PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Cooler and Breezy 4th of July Weekend... * Noticeably cooler temperatures at least 10-15 degrees below average are expected Sunday and Independence Day. Highs in the low 80s are possible in the lower valleys with upper-60s to low- 70s in Sierra valleys. This may feel like an abrupt change for many, especially in mountain communities.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California
